messageBody:
On 7/26/06, Joakim Ohlrogge <joakim.ohlrogge@...> wrote:
>
> > (Does Java 5 have a built-in
> > library method for loading a text file yet?!)
> I kind of like the way you do it in Java, create a BufferedReader and
> use readLine(). I think the Stream abstraction is really elegant and
> much prefer to work with it than directly with files.


Of course, it's very important to give low-level functions to achieve that
goal, but the fact that more than ten years after its inception, Java still
doesn't have a File#readEntireFile is absolutely baffling. I must have
written this function dozens of times myself.

Java makes hard things possible, but it certainly doesn't always make simple
things simple.

--
Cédric
